title: Today I learned
text:
A Quick Guide to Formatting with Quarto


Playing with quarto settings to learn more about how it works.



Jun 6, 2022














TidyModels - XGBoost


Learning Tidymodels package using the Volleyball dataset from TidyTuesday.



Jun 2, 2022














Naive Bayes with Tidymodels


Using Tidymodels to classify Netflix dataset with the help of Naive Bayes classifier.



May 28, 2022














Converting a distill website to Quarto


Using Quarto to make a responsive and minimal academic website/blog in RStudio



May 26, 2022














MDATools - PLS-DA Analysis


PLS-DA Analysis using the Iris Dataset and MDA-Tools package



May 26, 2022














TidyModels - KNN & GLM


Working with TidyModels to generate KNN and GLM models for the palmer penguins dataset.



May 24, 2022














EPL 2022 Final Table


Using gt package to create a great looking table for the EPL Standings 2021-22.



May 23, 2022














TidyModels - SVM & Random Forests


Learning Tidymodels package using the Chocolates dataset from TidyTuesday.



May 22, 2022














TidyModels - PCA and UMAP


Working with TidyModels to generate PCA and UMAP for Cocktail recipes. Using these recipes extrapolating the relation of a cocktail to each other.



May 22, 2022














VSCode vs RStudio — Worth the Switch?


Does Microsoft’s flagship code editor hold up against the old favorite?



May 19, 2022














Eurovision winners with gt() and gtextras()


Using gt() package to make a great looking table.



May 17, 2022














New York Times Bestsellers


Working with geom_jitter and ggrepel to create a great looking plot.



May 10, 2022










 



Making streamgraphs in R


TidyTuesday May 03,2022 ; Power and Energy Capacity visualization.



May 3, 2022














Amazon Bestsellers Data Analysis


KMeans and Exploratory Data Analysis.



Apr 26, 2022














Netflix Original Movies - EDA


Exploratory Data Analysis, and data vis with ggplot2.



Apr 21, 2022










 



Welcome to karat_codes


Welcome to my new blog, karat_codes.



May 21, 2020

title: Karat Sidhu
text:
I use the entire webpage:

as an online business card,
for people to have a quick & convenient place to get in touch with me
so people can get familiar with my qualifications and experience and;
for journalizing/learning things I am interested in through my blog.

title: Karat Sidhu
text:
Note:
Its a perpetual work in progress because I like to change up the formatting and themes occasionally and add stuff when necessary.
If you are interested in using this as a starting point for your own website, you are welcome to do so. Just fork the repo and get editing.
No attribution required for the template, but always appreciated.

Karat
